_header: I beshrew you by my fay
Subjects: women, as speakers/narrators; love, vicissitudes of; dialogues, lovers’

CamTCCVI182.First Lines:
I be shrew yow be ma my fayThis wanton Clarkes be nyce all
                    wayt…
CamTCCVI182.Last Lines:
…gvpp crischen clovt your breth is staillgo manerly mergerie
                    melke and aill
CamTCCVI182.Note: Added to a flyleaf, at end.
CamTCCVI182.Editions:
Edwards,  A. S. G.,  and  Linne R. Mooney.  
             “A New Version of a Skelton Lyric.” 
             Transactions of the Cambridge Bibliographical Society
         10 (1994): 507-11.
